meanings.definition: To shape or form roughly with an axe or other cutting tool.
meanings.sent1: He was roughhewing the wood to make a simple table for his workshop.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter spent hours roughhewing the logs into shape for the cabin.
meanings.sent3: After roughhewing the tree trunk, he realized he had accidentally made a chair instead of a table.
meanings.sent4: She roughhewed her emotions, cutting away the unnecessary parts to reveal her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the axe roughhewing the wood echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: To make or prepare in a rough or approximate way.
meanings.sent1: The chef was roughhewing the ingredients for a quick stew.
meanings.sent2: She roughhewed a makeshift shelter out of branches and leaves in the wilderness.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, he ended up roughhewing the speech, causing confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist roughhewed the sketch, capturing the essence of the scene in just a few lines.
meanings.sent5: The students were roughhewing their project, trying to finish it before the deadline.
